allRecords.text: To eliminate drift and create a strong snap for frontside spins, enter the jump with a light toe edge, transition to a flat base through the spoon of the jump, and then engage your heel edge for the wind-up and rotation.

allRecords.text: For park riding, choose a full camber board for superior snow grip, power, and responsiveness, especially for jumps.
allRecords.videoTitle: Is The TEAM PRO Right For You? Honest Board Review

allRecords.text: Maintain a slight board angle towards the corner of the jump on your edge before the jump to increase your turn radius, prevent drifting, and smooth your transition onto the jump.
allRecords.videoTitle: Breaking Down Pro Snowboard Spins – What I’m Missing (29-Minute Study)

allRecords.text: To improve your snowboarding, leverage expert knowledge and experiences that have been hard-earned over time.
allRecords.videoTitle: Snowboard Levels EXPLAINED (You Might Be Better Than You Think)

allRecords.text: If your boots are size 10 or larger, opt for a wide snowboard to prevent toe and heel drag, which impedes deep carving and can cause your boots to hit the snow.
allRecords.videoTitle: The Simplest Snowboard Buying Guide (No BS, No Sponsers)

allRecords.text: **Rotate your upper body 90 degrees over your front foot to enable counter-rotation and clean up your turns.**
allRecords.videoTitle: How Liam Brearley Uses Counter-Rotation To "DOMINATE"

allRecords.text: When turning to your heel edge, adjust your upper body to stay balanced over the board. When jumping, avoid fully extending your legs; instead, bend them to maintain your center of balance.
allRecords.videoTitle: The Foundation of All Snowboarding — Train This Off-Season!

allRecords.text: **Preemptively tilt your hips to your toe edge to initiate spins, then use your weight shift to your heels for a powerful pop and snap.**
allRecords.videoTitle: 5 Snowboard Exercises I Do Every Day — Here's Why

allRecords.text: **Initiate spins with a "dunking" motion by extending your legs and driving your arms downward, while keeping your chest tall and over your toe edge to generate rotational speed and control.**

allRecords.text: Master smooth transitions between your toe edge and heel edge stances.

samples.text: **Channel your rotational momentum off the jump by pushing your back hip closed, then opening your hips and upper body with your arms to maintain spin and control.**

samples.text: Practice maintaining a strong, flexible stance with a wide range of motion, allowing for slight variations in your position without losing control or balance.

samples.text: **Maintain tail pressure by shifting your weight back to your rear hip while pulling your upper body forward, ensuring your rotation pivots off the tail for a powerful takeoff.**

allRecords.text: For spins, leave the ground by pressing down on your tail throughout the lip, not by popping a large ollie, and maintain tail pressure for a stable rotation.
allRecords.videoTitle: You’re Not Supposed to Jump or Ollie When Doing Tricks

allRecords.text: To effectively use counter-rotation for spins, lead your upper body rotation slightly before popping, ensuring your shoulders are not fully squared or overly rotated.
allRecords.videoTitle: This Off Snow Training Will Make You A Better Snowboarder!!! (No Gear Needed)

allRecords.text: **Master counter-rotation:** Utilize early upper body rotation to control spins, allowing for more precise grabs and preventing over-rotation, especially on larger jumps.
allRecords.videoTitle: How Kevin Backstrom Makes Every Trick Look Effortless!

allRecords.text: **Don't rush tricks on features you're not ready for, and ensure you have proper equipment and jump size before attempting advanced maneuvers.**
allRecords.videoTitle: I Made These Mistakes So You Don’t Have To! - EP 4

allRecords.text: **Adopt a stacked, counter-rotated body position with your head centered over the jump to achieve a fluid, "balls of feet" rotation.**
allRecords.videoTitle: Unlock Total Control with Counter Rotation – Tramp Like a Snowboarder Ep 2

allRecords.text: **Avoid "breaking at the waist" by reaching for a grab before your board leaves the jump; instead, focus on proper body extension and hip shift for a powerful, controlled takeoff.**
allRecords.videoTitle: I Made These Mistakes So You Don’t Have To! - EP 3

allRecords.text: Focus on channeling energy through a smooth extension of your legs from bent to tall, rather than aggressively jumping, to maintain momentum and avoid losing potential height.
allRecords.videoTitle: Unlock Your Frontside Potential This Summer!—No Equipment Required

allRecords.text: **Leave the jump off your tail to create a staggered leg bend and maintain air position, avoiding a time-delaying extension.**
allRecords.videoTitle: You’re Not Supposed to Jump or Ollie When Doing Tricks

allRecords.text: Practice consistent, controlled jumps on a trampoline with a slight bend in your knees and a forward upper body hinge to build a solid foundation for more advanced maneuvers.

allRecords.text: Use an airbag for a safe, low-cost environment to learn and practice new snowboarding tricks, allowing you to experiment with techniques and build confidence before taking them to snow.

allRecords.text: **Preemptively open your chest 90° away from your rotation direction before takeoff to allow your legs to catch up and facilitate a cleaner spin.**
allRecords.videoTitle: FUNDAMENTALS Pushed To The Max And what you can learn from it!

allRecords.text: Maintain an upright upper body and focus the bend in your back leg, keeping your weight over the balls of your feet, to stay within your effective range of motion for straight airs.
allRecords.videoTitle: Improving Your Straight Airs

allRecords.text: **For jumps, maintain an athletic stance with a slight bend in your legs, avoid excessive squatting, and flatten your base before popping for maximum control and power.**
allRecords.videoTitle: Top Snowboarding Mistakes Holding You Back (And How to Fix Them!)

allRecords.text: Initiate your takeoff by dropping your shoulder in coordination with your lower body to set a downhill trajectory and facilitate a quicker grab.
allRecords.videoTitle: Live Coaching: Backside Rotations Made Easy

allRecords.text: Maintain a flexible body position and core balance throughout your trick, rather than forcing rotation with your legs, to allow for minor form imperfections.
allRecords.videoTitle: You’re Not Supposed to Jump or Ollie When Doing Tricks

allRecords.text: **Aggressively approach jumps with an open chest and hips angled towards the corner, bending early to facilitate a powerful wind-up and faster transition.**

allRecords.text: Maintain a bent-down front board position through the takeoff, utilizing counter-rotation of the hips for rotation rather than an ollie or leg extension.

allRecords.text: Maintain a strong, centered body position with minimal movement, extending through your tail for powerful, controlled pops off side hits.

allRecords.text: Reduce stress to improve focus and air awareness for better trick execution.

allRecords.text: To pop and gain height off side hits, push your board into the snow and mold it to the feature's contours to maximize contact time, rather than just lifting your legs.

allRecords.text: **Focus on what you *want* to do at takeoff, not what you want to avoid, to ensure your body executes the desired action.**

allRecords.text: **Minimize upper body rotation and maintain a gradual board angle on the takeoff to avoid excessive sideways momentum and pre-mature leaning.**

allRecords.text: To maximize your trick count, perform variations of tricks (e.g., cab 5 vs. cab underfoot 5) and execute them on different features (e.g., jumps vs. hips).

allRecords.text: **Maintain a strong, balanced base with your knees forward and upper body hinged to avoid popping out of your effective range of motion, which improves snap and consistency.**

allRecords.text: **Adopt a balanced stance with slight backward weight shift and a more upright upper body, ensuring you have 20% more room to squat and extend while actively pushing your legs into the snow for maximum power.**
